title: Robert Esposito
text:
PhD student — Bilingualism & Second Language Acquisition

Rutgers University

Hi! I’m Robert, a PhD student in the department of Spanish & Portuguese at Rutgers University in New Brunswick, NJ. I study bilingualism and second language acquisition. I’m particularly interested in the acquisition of phonology and phonetics in bilinguals, with a special focus on prosody and intonation. I’m also interested in statistical analysis and open science practices.

title: Research
text:
OverviewCV



I mainly work in phonetics, laboratory phonology, and second language acquisition. My main research questions focus on how L2 learners acquire their L2 prosodic system. I am a member of the Rutgers Applied Phonetics Group, organized by Dr. Joseph Casillas: https://RAP-group.github.io. I am also a proponent of Open Science. More information can be found here: https://fosil-project.github.io/.
